comment: If a power of a prime ` P ` (i.e. ` P ^ M ` ) is of the form ` 2 ^ N - 1 ` , then ` N ` must be prime and ` M ` must be ` 1 ` . Generalization of ~ mersenne (where ` M = 1 ` is a prerequisite). Theorem of S. Ligh and L. Neal (1974) "A note on Mersenne mumbers", Mathematics Magazine, 47:4, 231-233.
